  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(int rows, int cols)
      Creates a new board with the given dimensions. All cells are initially empty.
      Parameters:
      rows - number of rows in the board
      cols - number of columns in the board

  • Method Details

    • getRows

      public int getRows()
      Returns the number of rows on the board.
      Returns:
      the number of rows

    • getCols

      public int getCols()
      Returns the number of rows on the board.
      Returns:
      the number of rows

    • getGrid

      public char[][] getGrid()
      Returns the reference to the grid.
      Returns:
      the grid

    • canPlace

      public boolean canPlace(Block block, int row, int col)
      Checks if the given block can be placed at position (row, col). It verifies that every cell in the block that is "filled" (true) maps to a valid board coordinate that is currently empty.
      Parameters:
      block - the block to be placed
      row - the row on the board for the block's top-left corner
      col - the column on the board for the block's top-left corner
      Returns:
      true if the block can be placed, false otherwise

    • placeBlock

      public boolean placeBlock(Block block, int row, int col)
      Places the block on the board at the given position (row, col) if possible. This method assumes that canPlace(Block, int, int) has been checked.
      Parameters:
      block - the block to place
      row - the row on the board for the block's top-left corner
      col - the column on the board for the block's top-left corner
      Returns:
      true if the block was successfully placed, false if placement is invalid

    • removeBlock

      public boolean removeBlock(Block block, int row, int col)
      Removes the block from the board from the specified position (row, col). The method checks that the block's symbol is present at the expected locations before removal.
      Parameters:
      block - the block to remove
      row - the row where the block was placed
      col - the column where the block was placed
      Returns:
      true if the block was successfully removed, false if the board cells did not match the block's symbol

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard()
      Prints the board to the console. Each cell is separated by a space.

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Checks if the board is completely filled. This method considers only cells that are available for filling (i.e. those that are EMPTY).
      Returns:
      true if no EMPTY cell exists in the board, false otherwise

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the board by clearing all placed blocks while preserving the boundary cells. That is, any cell that is not marked as a BLOCK_BOUNDARY is set to EMPTY.

    • setMask

      public void setMask(boolean[][] mask)
      Applies a custom mask to the board. The mask is provided as a 2D boolean array with the same dimensions as the board. If mask[r][c] is true, that cell is set to BLOCK_BOUNDARY to indicate it cannot be filled.
      Parameters:
      mask - a boolean 2D array representing boundary (non-fillable) cells
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the mask dimensions do not match the board dimensions
